title: "Quarto Hub"

## Overview

Quarto Hub is a browser-based collaborative editor for Quarto documents. It provides real-time editing, live preview, and seamless collaboration without requiring any local software installation.

::: {.callout-warning}
## Prototype Software

Quarto Hub is currently a prototype under active development. Features may change, and some functionality may be incomplete. Use it to explore and experiment, but be aware that it is not yet production-ready.
:::

## Key Features

- **Browser-Based**: Edit Quarto documents directly in your web browser with no installation required
- **Live Preview**: See your rendered document update in real-time as you type
- **Collaborative Editing**: Multiple users can edit the same project simultaneously
- **Theme Support**: Choose from Bootswatch themes or create custom styles with SCSS
- **File Templates**: Create project-specific templates for consistent document structure

## Getting Started

1. **Open Quarto Hub**: Navigate to the Quarto Hub URL in your browser
2. **Create or Open a Project**: Use the project selector to create a new project or open an existing one
3. **Edit Your Document**: Use the Monaco-based editor on the left to write your Quarto markdown
4. **View the Preview**: The right panel shows your rendered document, updating as you type

## Interface Overview

The Quarto Hub interface is divided into several areas:

- **Toolbar**: Project name, file tabs, and action buttons
- **File Sidebar**: Navigate and manage project files
- **Editor**: Monaco-based text editor with syntax highlighting
- **Preview Panel**: Live-rendered view of your document
- **Outline Panel**: Navigate your document structure
